articles.title: Greetings to Pakistani President
articles.content:
Greetings to Pakistani President
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Mamnoon Hussain, president of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan, on Friday on the occasion of the Day of Pakistan.
					 The message wished the Pakistani president success in his responsible work and the Pakistani people happiness and prosperity, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries with long history and tradition would develop on the principle of independence, equality and mutual respect.

articles.title: DPRK Central Public Prosecutors Office Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Central Public Prosecutors Office Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the DPRK Central Public Prosecutors Office led by Director Kim Myong Gil returned home on Friday after visiting Cuba.

articles.title: Pakistani Embassy Gives Reception
articles.content:
Pakistani Embassy Gives Reception
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The Pakistani embassy here arranged a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Friday to mark the Day of Pakistan.
					 Present there on invitation were Pak Chun Nam, minister of Culture, Ryu Myong Son, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Choe Hui Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned and foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international bodies here and staff members of foreign embassies.
					
					 Charge d'Affaires ad interim Syed Sajjad Haider and officials of the Pakistani embassy were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: 1st Pyongyang Int'l Vocal Concours to Be Held
articles.content:
1st Pyongyang Int'l Vocal Concours to Be Held
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The First Pyongyang International Vocal Concours will take place here to celebrate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 It will bring together international and national vocal concours winners and ace singers from the DPRK and other countries.
					
					 The concours is to be held at the Moranbong Theatre from April 5 to 12, divided into male and female groups.
					
					 During the concours there will be a Pyongyang international seminar on the times and musical art.

articles.title: New Species of Loach Bred in DPRK
articles.content:
New Species of Loach Bred in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- A new species of fleshy and highly nutritive loach, designated as the loach of Pyongyang breed, was recently bred and its farming technology established in the DPRK.
					 The new species of loach grows quickly, lays much spawn for all seasons and multiplies enormously.
					
					 It is also highly adaptable to the environment and has a good appetite. It tastes peculiar, free from smell of mud, and is much higher than other freshwater fishes in nutritive value. And it is possible only 7 or 8 months after from its hatching-out to net it.
					
					 The Fish Farming Guidance Bureau under the Ministry of Fisheries settled its food problem in cooperation with teachers and researchers of Kim Hyong Jik University of Education.
					
					 According to Kim Yong Chol, an official of the Ministry of Fisheries, the new species of loach is high in biological indicators and can be bred in any fishpond.
					
					 Now, it is being carried out at the final stage to build an establishment with the capacity of producing myriads of breed loaches per year, he said.

articles.title: Efforts for Putting Weather and Flood Forecasts on IT Basis
articles.content:
Efforts for Putting Weather and Flood Forecasts on IT Basis
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- March 23 is the World Meteorological Day.
					 On this occasion, the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) set "Weather-ready, climate-smart" as the theme for this year and advanced it as one of the top priorities of the WMO and National Meteorological and Hydrological Services to protect lives, livelihoods and property from the risks related to weather, climate and water events.
					
					 When interviewed by KCNA, Pang Sun Nyo, section chief of the State Hydro-meteorological Administration of the DPRK, said:
					
					 In recent years, the DPRK has witnessed extreme phenomena like temperature rise, heavy rain and drought caused by the global warming. To cope with abnormal meteorological phenomena, it has steadily carried out the project to put weather and flood forecasts on an IT basis.
					
					 The administration has pressed ahead with such projects for putting all the processes of meteorological sector on an IT basis as making real-time observation through the expansion of automatic meteorological observation network and applying scientific methods to forecasts for small and medium meteorological phenomena and weather changes.
					
					 Efforts have also been paid to regularly observe climate, floodgate conditions, etc. and promptly inform agriculture, transport and other sectors of the observations in order to help them take due measures.
					
					 The State Hydro-meteorological Administration of the DPRK will strive to put the country's hydro-meteorological services on a higher IT basis and strengthen the international cooperation and collaboration with the WMO.

articles.title: Monument to Great Victory in Pukgwan
articles.content:
Monument to Great Victory in Pukgwan
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- March 23 is the day that the Monument to the Great Victory in Pukgwan taken back from Japan in March 2006 was replaced in Rimmyong-ri, Kim Chaek City, North Hamgyong Province of the DPRK.
					 The monument is a monumental stone to the victory built in 1708 to hand down to posterity the feats performed by the Hamgyong provincial volunteer army of Korea in defeating the Japanese aggressors during the Imjin Patriotic War (1592-1598).
					
					 The Japanese imperialists plundered the monument, a precious cultural property symbolic of the patriotic spirit of the Korean nation, in 1905.
					
					 At the 15th ministerial talks between the north and south of Korea held in June Juche 94 (2005), the north and the south agreed on taking practical measures to retrieve the monument from Japan.
					
					 By the concerted efforts of the north and the south, the monument came to be returned 100 years after from when it was taken away by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 The monument, replaced in a preservation area covering 20,000-odd square meters, is 249 cm in total height.
					
					 Inscribed on the monumental stone, 187 cm high, 66 cm wide and 13 cm thick, are more than 1,400 letters telling about Japan's aggression on Korea, the organization and activities of the Hamgyong provincial volunteer army and its victories battles against the invaders.
					
					 Its pedestal was discovered in the preservation area and ascertained with historical evidences when the preparations for its restoration were being made.
					
					 The Monument to the Great Victory in Pukgwan was registered as the national treasure of the DPRK No. 193.

articles.title: Turn in Improvement of People's Standard of Living Called for
articles.content:
Turn in Improvement of People's Standard of Living Called for
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Friday editorially calls for making a turn in the improvement of people's standard of living by accelerating the development of light industry.
					 Noting that the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) set it as the main task for socialist economic construction this year to strengthen the independence and Juche character of the national economy and improve the people's standard of living, the editorial says:
					
					 This represents the noble intention of our Party to make the 70th birthday of the DPRK the greatest event of significance by bringing about a decisive turn in the improvement of people's standard of living.
					
					 We have solid material and technical foundations for consumer goods production, laid in Pyongyang and localities under the wise leadership of the Party, and excellent models and plenty of experience for the rapid development of the light industry.
					
					 When the potentials of light industry are given full reign to  effect a great upsurge in production, can cheers for the WPK and socialism resound far and wide in the sky of September.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and their vassal forces are now making desperate efforts to hold in check our vigorous advance and stamp out our idea and system.
					
					 The great spirit of self-reliance displayed in the light industrial field and all the consumer goods produced with our resources and efforts will be a merciless telling blow to the hostile forces.
					
					 All the officials and workers in the field of light industry should redouble their efforts to bring about a great turn in the improvement of people's standard of living through the on-going revolutionary general offensive in hearty response to the Party's militant call.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. and Its Vassal Forces' Sanctions Racket against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. and Its Vassal Forces' Sanctions Racket against DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Dignitaries of the White House and departments of state and defense of the U.S. are crying out for "maintaining the policy of maximum pressure" on the DPRK, whenever they open their mouths. Vassal forces including Japan are echoing it, saying that the prevailing situation on the Korean peninsula is a proof of effective sanctions and the sanctions should be maintained as ever.
					 Rodong Sinmun's Friday commentary terms this sheer nonsense of those hell-bent on sanctions racket.
					
					 The positive climate prevailing on the Korean peninsula was created thanks to the proactive measures and efforts of the DPRK and it can by no means be the result of the U.S. and its vassal forces' sanctions, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 U.S. sanctions do not work on the DPRK. The more pressure the U.S. puts on the DPRK, the stronger Juche Korea becomes, endangering the destiny of the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. and its vassal forces are desperately resorting to the toughest sanctions and pressure racket against the DPRK by employing all means and methods. But this is just a last-ditch effort to get rid of fear and despair caused by their defeat and wretched plight.
					
					 If the U.S. persists in acting rashly, not drawing a lesson from its failure in the showdown with the DPRK, the former is bound to face bitterer disgrace and defeat.

articles.title: Traitor Lee Myung Bak Detained
articles.content:
Traitor Lee Myung Bak Detained
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak was detained at dawn of Friday for high-profile graft, according to KBS and MBC of south Korea.
					 The authorities of the Seoul Central District Court issued a warrant for his detention in judgment that traitor Lee may destroy evidence.
					
					 The traitor became the fourth former "president" who was jailed after traitors Chun Doo Hwan, Roh Tae Woo and Park Geun Hye.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Introduced in Nigeria
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Introduced in Nigeria
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted on its website President Kim Il Sung's work "Strengthening the Party and Enhancing Its Role Is the Basic Guarantee for the Victory of Revolution" on March 16.
					 The work, published on October 10, Juche 79 (1990), clarifies the idea that in order to successfully carry out the revolutionary tasks, it is important to further strengthen the Workers' Party of Korea and steadily enhance its role.
					
					 It also stresses the need to further develop the WPK into a revolutionary party of Juche, closely united in an organizational and ideological way and possessed of the invincible fighting efficiency, by thoroughly embodying the party-building principle of Juche. -0-

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Russia
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for marking the 106th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was formed by the Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK on Mar. 14.
					 Lebedev, chief of the Group, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee fixed a celebration period from Mar. 14 to April 15 and decided to give wide publicity to the revolutionary career and feats of the President through media and organize a seminar, film show and other political and cultural events in the period.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Pakistan
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Pakistan
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- A Pakistani national preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was formed in Karachi on Mar. 14.
					 A senator was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to give wide publicity to the feats performed by the President for the Korean revolution and global independence and the successes made by the Korean people in the building of a powerful socialist country and to hold colorful political and cultural events on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Bulgaria
 Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for marking the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was formed in Sofia on Mar. 15.
					 Mincho Minchev, chairman of the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set a celebration period from Mar. 16 to April 15 and decided to hold colorful political and cultural events such as celebration meeting, seminar and book and photo exhibition in the period.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente pakistani
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente pakistani
Pyongyang, 23 de marzo (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 23 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica Islamica de Pakistan, Mamnoon Hussain, con motivo del Dia de Pakistan.
					En la misiva, el remitente expreso la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises con larga historia y tradicion se ampliaran y se desarrollaran en el principio de independencia, igualdad y respeto mutuo y deseo exitos en el desempeno de las responsabilidades del destinatario y la felicidad y prosperidad del pueblo pakistani.

articles.title: Regresa de Cuba la delegacion de Fiscalia Central de la RPDC
articles.content:
Regresa de Cuba la delegacion de Fiscalia Central de la RPDC
Pyongyang, 23 de marzo (ACNC) -- Regreso el dia 23 la delegacion de la Fiscalia Central, encabezada por su presidente Kim Myong Gil, que habia realizado una visita a Cuba.

articles.title: Se realizara primer Concurso Internacional de Musica Vocal de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Se realizara primer Concurso Internacional de Musica Vocal de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 23 de marzo (ACNC) -- Con motivo del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung, tendra lugar desde el dia 5 hasta el 12 de abril en el capitalino Teatro Moranbong el primer Concurso Internacional de Musica Vocal de Pyongyang.
					En la ocasion participaran los ganadores de concursos internacionales y nacionales y los cantantes sobresalientes de la RPDC y otros paises del mundo.
					
					El concurso se efectuara dividido en la categoria masculina y la femenina.
					
					Durante el evento, esta programado el seminario internacional de Pyongyang sobre la epoca y el arte musical.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun critica la opinion de mantener la sancion y presion anti-RPDC
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun critica la opinion de mantener la sancion y presion anti-RPDC
Pyongyang, 23 de marzo (ACNC) -- Ahora, las figuras de alto rango de la Casa Blanca y los Departamentos de Estado y Defensa de Estados Unidos suelen decir que "mantendran la politica de maxima presion". 
					Haciendose eco de lo que habla su amo gringo, Japon y otros satelites insisten en mantener la sancion anticoreana anadiendo que la actual situacion de la Peninsula Coreana es una prueba de su efectividad.
					
					El diario Rodong Sinmun publico el dia 23 un comentario individual para refutar esa chismografia de los obsesionados por la campana de sancion.
					
					El buen clima de la Peninsula Coreana no es un efecto de la sancion de EE.UU. y sus satelites, sino fue preparado por las iniciativas y esfuerzos de la RPDC, afirma el comentarista y prosigue:
					
					La sancion norteamericana no sale con la suya en la RPDC.
					
					La escalada de la presion de EE.UU. trajo el resultado de hacer mas fuerte a la Corea del Juche y poner en el peligro mas grave el destino del mismo imperio americano.
					
					Aunque EE.UU. y sus seguidores movilizan todos los medios y metodos para imponer la sancion superdura a la RPDC, esto no pasa de ser la accion agonica para liberarse del pavor a la derrota tragica.
					
					Si EE.UU. sigue actuando con temeridad en lugar de sacar la leccion de la confrontacion con la RPDC, sufrira la verguenza y la derrota mas grandes.
